column4: Got a problem with an HP Omnibook 6100 (my good old laptop) and newer Ubuntu releases.  It freezes or reboots (either or) with newer kernels.  Worked nice up until 6.10 (I think), 7.04, 7.10 and 8.04 causes hang/reboot during bootup.  Bug 89892 seems to be the one hitting me (and others)
And for some reason it's marked 'wontfix'. :-/
does this happen only with 8.04?
er, sorry, i mis-read the problem. have you tried any kernel switches?
Nah, 7.04 and 7.10 too.
noacpi and so forth has been tried.
No joy, though.
i'm not familiar with the "so forth" switch. :) could you please elaborate?
Hmm.  *tries to remember*.  noapic?
no sure if turning off APIC would help... have you tried re-routing interrupts?
Nope.
not familiar with rereouting interrupts.
okay - keeping APIC on is usually a good thing. pci=routeirq  usually takes care of hangs/lockups
According to the bugreport that others have filed, some have had success removing / moving away the intel-rng.ko
But I had no joy with that. :-/
well, give this a shot and see what happens :)
I will as soon as it's finished with its current task.  :)
ok
Tad annoying that it's marked 'medium,nofix' though - with no proper resolution.  The bug, that is.
yeah, i'm looking at them right now
i'm guessing you have done this, but i'd rather not assume that you have: have you gone through HP's troubleshooting guide?
